node.title: Barack Obama Returns to Climate Talks With a Call for ‘Ongoing Activism’
node.alt: Former President Barack Obama, center, at the COP26 climate summit in Glasgow on Monday.
node.description: The American leader who helped seal the Paris climate accord arrived in Glasgow to cheers from delegates and pushback from some activists.
node.content: ["GLASGOW \u2014 Former President Barack Obama, who helped to seal the Paris climate agreement six years ago, appeared at the climate summit here to assure a global audience that despite American political divisions, officials remain committed to the cause.", "\u201cPolitics in the United States are not always easy,\u201d he said. \u201cMy successor maybe wasn\u2019t as interested in climate science as I was, it turns out.\u201d", "His successor, Donald J. Trump, pulled the United States out of the Paris accord and unwound more than 100 of Mr. Obama\u2019s environmental regulations. The Obama administration\u2019s original targets to reduce its emissions of planet-warming greenhouse gases remain unmet, and it\u2019s unclear exactly how the new targets set by President Biden will be fulfilled, given the obstacles he has faced in Congress.", "\u201cIt\u2019s one of the things about democracy,\u201d said Mr. Obama, who took no questions from reporters. \u201cYou don\u2019t always get your way.\u201d", "Mr. Obama\u2019s appearance at the summit was greeted with enormous enthusiasm, with a large crowd of delegates crowding around to catch a glimpse of the former president and loudly cheering as he walked into the hall.", "Mr. Obama noted that the United States, the nation that has historically pumped the most greenhouse gas emissions into the atmosphere, was a target of critics at the summit. But he suggested that criticism aimed at members of the American delegation was misplaced.", "\u201cSometimes it will feel like the U.S. and some of the other countries are not always moving as fast or following through with commitments as much as we like,\u201d he said. \u201cIt\u2019s not for lack of trying by the people who are working here.\u201d", "Mr. Obama\u2019s agenda was carefully curated. He spoke first to leaders of several island countries already feeling the acute impacts of climate change, emphasizing the need for money to help vulnerable countries adapt to a hotter planet and describing himself as \u201can island kid.\u201d", "He was scheduled to attend a closed-door session with a bloc of countries that call themselves the High Ambition Coalition. His day at the two-week summit, which is the 26th session of the Conference of Parties to the United Nations climate change convention, or COP26, ends with a round table with a group of youth advocating for climate action.", "But even before he began speaking, pushback came from some young activists, who criticized the United States for not paying its fair share of financial aid to help poor countries address climate change.", "The activist Vanessa Nakate wrote on Twitter that she was 13 when the former president promised that the countries of the global north would shore up $100 billion in climate financing a year by 2020. That money hasn\u2019t yet materialized. \u201cThe US has broken that promise, it will cost lives in Africa,\u201d she tweeted. \u201cYou want to meet #COP26 youth. We want action.\u201d", "It is a current running through the proceedings: young activists angry at the older presidents and prime ministers of big polluter nations for failing to act swiftly to reduce emissions and aid those most vulnerable to climate disasters.", "Mr. Obama said Monday that rich industrialized countries like the United States had \u201can added burden\u201d to aid nations at the front lines of climate impacts. The United States has been under pressure to increase funding to help countries adapt to climate risks already upon them. The Biden administration has pledged $11.4 billion in climate aid over the next few years, with roughly a fourth of that for adaptation, though that money still requires congressional approval.", "\u201cThose of us who live in big wealthy nations, those of us who helped to precipitate the problem, we have an added burden to make sure that we are working with and helping and assisting those who are less responsible and less able and more vulnerable to this oncoming crisis,\u201d Mr. Obama said.", "For decades, many of the most vulnerable countries have pressed for reparations from rich industrialized countries, as part of what they call a loss and damage fund. The United States and other rich countries have long been reluctant to agree to anything that opens them up to liability.", "The Marshall Islands said it would need \u201ctens of billions\u201d of dollars for adaptation, including to elevate its territory and move its people away from harm\u2019s way.", "Mr. Obama offered a nod to the fury of the young, at one point crediting them for their ability to \u201cspeak truth to power.\u201d", "\u201cUs old folks, the gray-haired types or no-haired types sometimes I think make excuses,\u201d he said.", "He took pains to note that the pledges made so far could significantly slow down temperature rise, if they are kept.", "\u201cThat\u2019s real progress, not enough, but it moves us in right direction,\u201d he said. \u201cThat requires ongoing activism in between.\u201d"]
